definition: to treat only the symptoms but not the root cause
to rule/to govern/to manage/to control/to harness (a river)/to treat (a disease)/to wipe out (a pest)/to punish/to research

mark/sign/label/to mark with a symbol, label, lettering etc/to bear (a brand name, registration number etc)/prize/award/bid/target/quota/(old) the topmost branches of a tree/visible symptom/classifier for military units
to treat the symptoms but not the root cause
Greenwich Mean Time/GMT
pinyin: Ge2 lin2 wei1 zhi4 Biao1 zhun3 shi2 jian1

definition: Greenwich Mean Time (GMT)
pinyin: Ge2 lin2 ni2 zhi4 Biao1 zhun3 shi2 jian1

sentences.english: Dredging is only a temporary solution to this problem.
sentences.chinese: 疏浚解決河口淤積問題只治標。

sentences.english: But such bond-buying is a temporary palliative.
sentences.chinese: 但這種債券買法治標不治本。

sentences.english: Scotch tape may solve the problem temporarily, but it cannot take the problem away.
sentences.chinese: 膠紙或許能暫時地解決問題，但是它治標不治本。

sentences.english: Financial aid is only subsidiary method, the essential solution is to amend the policy.
sentences.chinese: 財政支持只是輔助手段，治標的辦法是進行政策改良。

sentences.english: A bailout will not address the fundamental causes of Greece's fiscal problems.
sentences.chinese: 金援對於希臘的財政問題來說只是治標不治本。

sentences.english: “Caring is good, but it treats the symptoms without addressing the root cause of the problem,” says Ye Jingzhong.
sentences.chinese: 葉精忠說，“關愛是好的，但這治標不治本。”

sentences.english: That can only be a temporary stopgap, repeated attacks lead to acne.
sentences.chinese: 那樣只能是治標不治標，招致青春痘重複發作。

sentences.english: That can only be a temporary stopgap, repeated attacks lead to acne.
sentences.chinese: 那樣只能是治標不治標，招致青春痘重複發作。

sentences.english: “Caring is good, but it treats the symptoms without addressing the root cause of the problem, ” says Ye Jingzhong.
sentences.chinese: 葉精忠說，“關愛是好的，但這治標不治本。”
這樣的行動是治標不治本的。

sentences.english: But in my opinion, these stopgap measures, not cure.
sentences.chinese: 但在我看來，這些治標的措施，無法治本。

sentences.english: However, these ways could not deal with the true problem.
sentences.chinese: 這些解決辦法治標不治本，沒有抓住問題的實質。

sentences.english: This was what Marshall had meant when he talked of "a cure rather than a palliative, " nothing less.
sentences.chinese: 而這正是馬歇爾“要治本而不要治標”的本意。

sentences.english: But critics say the circular only "scratches the surface of a problem".
sentences.chinese: 但是評論家們認爲該項通知“治標不治本”。

definition: to treat the symptoms/reactive (rather than proactive)
lit. to prescribe the right medicine for an illness (idiom); fig. to study a problem to find the right way to solve it/to take appropriate steps
to produce the opposite of the desired result
lit. set up a pole and see the shadow (idiom); fig. instant effect/quick results
correct diagnosis/to prescribe the right cure for an illness/to suit the medicine to the illness
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
top priority job/matter of vital importance
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
to work to no avail (idiom)
drug resistance (medicine)
nonfeasance/omission (law)
holistic diagnosis and treatment (TCM)
retort with challenging questions/debate
panacea/cure-all
ineradicable disease/fig. deep-seated problem/perennial problem
to get sth done once and for all
